question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code when possible. Which AI tool is currently capable of designing mini-program UI and generating code?

checklist.title: Is the AI tool evaluation comprehensive and accurate?
checklist.description: Review whether the response covers mainstream AI tools for mini-program development (such as GitHub Copilot, Cursor, v0.dev, Figma AI, Sketch2Code, etc.) and provides accurate capability assessments. Check if the evaluation includes both UI design and code generation capabilities. Score 0 if only 1-2 tools are mentioned, 5 if 3-5 tools are covered but lack detail, and 10 if comprehensive coverage with accurate capability analysis is provided.

checklist.title: Are practical code examples provided for each recommended tool?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether executable mini-program code samples are provided for each AI tool mentioned, demonstrating their actual code generation capabilities. Examples should include WeChat mini-program (.wxml, .wxss, .js files) or other platform equivalents. Deduct 3 points for each tool mentioned without a working code example. Full score requires all recommended tools to have corresponding executable demonstrations.

checklist.title: Is the UI design capability assessment detailed and demonstrable?
checklist.description: Check whether the response includes actual UI design outputs from the mentioned AI tools, with visual comparisons and design quality analysis. Should cover design-to-code workflow efficiency, component library integration, and responsive design capabilities. Deduct 5 points if no visual examples are provided, 3 points if design quality metrics are missing. Full score requires comprehensive UI capability demonstration with screenshots or mockups.

checklist.title: Are tool limitations and comparison criteria clearly established?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the response provides honest assessment of each tool's limitations, pricing models, learning curves, integration complexity, and suitable use cases. Should include comparative analysis matrix covering factors like accuracy, speed, platform support, and customization capabilities. Deduct 5 points if limitations are not mentioned, 3 points if comparison lacks objective criteria. Full score requires balanced pros/cons analysis with clear selection guidance.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the provided code examples can handle common abnormal situations (such as API failures, network interruption, invalid user input, platform compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle edge cases in mini-program environments, giving 10 points. If robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative insights or cutting-edge developments highlighted?
checklist.description: Check whether the response includes emerging trends in AI-powered development (e.g., 1. Multi-modal design-to-code conversion 2. Real-time collaborative AI coding 3. Cross-platform code generation optimization 4. AI-powered accessibility compliance checking). Add 3 points for each practical innovative insight provided with concrete examples (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant or outdated recommendations?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of issues: 1. Outdated tools that are no longer maintained or effective 2. Redundant recommendations of similar tools without clear differentiation 3. Off-topic suggestions not related to mini-program development. Deduct 3 points for each redundant or outdated recommendation found, and directly deduct 10 points if core mini-program development requirements are not addressed.

checklist.title: Does the response demonstrate engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review whether code examples follow mini-program best practices including proper file structure, component modularity, performance optimization, and platform-specific guidelines. Deduct 5 points if code lacks proper organization or violates platform conventions; deduct 5 points if performance considerations are ignored; deduct 5 points if security best practices are not followed. Full score requires professional-grade code structure.

checklist.title: Do the UI examples meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether UI examples or screenshots follow modern mini-program design principles: 1) Consistent with platform design guidelines (WeChat/Alipay design systems) 2) Proper component spacing and hierarchy 3) Mobile-first responsive design considerations 4) Accessibility compliance. Deduct 3 points for each design guideline violation, 5 points for poor visual hierarchy, and 5 points for mobile usability issues. Full score requires platform-compliant professional design quality.

checklist.title: Is the workflow integration seamless and practical?
checklist.description: Judge whether the recommended tools integrate smoothly into real development workflows: 1) Clear setup and integration instructions 2) Compatibility with existing development environments 3) Efficient design-to-development handoff processes 4) Team collaboration capabilities. Deduct 5 points for each missing integration step, 3 points for unclear documentation, and 5 points if workflow efficiency gains are not demonstrated. Full score requires complete end-to-end workflow demonstration.
